instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.A1286: What is A1286? A1286 is a model number for a 15 inch size MacBook Pro Unibody from years Late 2008, Mid 2009, Mid 2009 , Mid 2010, Early 2011, Late 2011, Mid 2012 with EMC 2255, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-2330, 820-2532, 820-2523, 820-2533, 820-2850, 820-2915, 820-3330..
definitions.A1297: What is A1297? A1297 is a model number for a 17 inch size MacBook Pro Unibody from years Early 2009, Mid 2009, Mid 2010, Early 2011, Late 2011 with EMC 2272, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-2390, 820-2610, 820-2849, 820-2914..
definitions.820-2914: What is 820-2914? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1286</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>  2011 i7 15 inch gpu
threads.message:
Can someone direct me to a shop/website/person where i can buy brand new GPU for those models, i know its not that easy to source a real good working, brand new one.

Also, i have this model, the gpu was reflowed twice, atm we cant replace the gpu cause we are still looking to source one (maybe 10-20 pcs), but for the moment im looking for even a temporary solution. So this laptop started to work after the GPU reflow, but failed in 1 month, was reflowed again, now works, but in OSX it starts to slow down after 10 mins, interesting that its not slow for a while, than even the mosue is very slow. I tried with a new SSD and new hdd cable and its the same thing, altough there is no typical GPU issue, like lines on screen, or discoloration, only this slow down. 
Now i installed Windows 10, and with the newest bootcamp driver it wont install, cause officaly the 2011 model doesnt support windows 10, but with a bit older bootcamp drivers it is working now, and more interestingly it wont slow down, is that becasue windows is using the I7 integrated grapshics and it would change to the dedicated one while in 3d application? 
Can someone shed a light on this to me? I know replacing the GPU would be the best but until the sourcing is sorted i need a soultion.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1286</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>  2011 i7 15 inch gpu
<MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1286</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>  2011 i7 15 inch gpu
threads.message: Forget it, this party is over. It will be months before there is any chance of new GPUs becoming available. It is a big mine field of fake crap out there and not worth dealing with if you are buying 20 chips. I have about 100 chips left and would only sell them for at least $100 each, because if they are gone, they are gone at this point.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1286</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>  2011 i7 15 inch gpu
threads.message: will u sell me like 5 pcs?

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1286</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>  2011 i7 15 inch gpu
<MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1286</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>  2011 i7 15 inch gpu
threads.message:
would u sell it balled? at the moment i have only a simple setup (infrared heater bottom and top) , so if the chip comes with balls i could just position it and melt it to its place (its fully manual but i have experience to operate it, its not measuring the temp, so i cant setup an automated heat profile )
Also do u have the GPU for the <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1297</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2914</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B 17 incher? is that the same gpu as for the <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1286</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>?

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1286</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>  2011 i7 15 inch gpu
threads.message: All new chips come with balls. If you have no experience working with GPUs this is not going to end well.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1286</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>  2011 i7 15 inch gpu
threads.message:
we have loads of xp with reflow in general, and bga replacement with smaller chips, also you have to start somewhere to get the xp :) 
We possibly will have some 1286 and <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1297</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> orders, if the customer accepts around 450-550eur for the repair (with a possible new hdd + osx + data backup, as they are old devices) i think its worth to take the risk to  go with the gpu replacement.  If u can sell us few chips please PM me with the details of shipping and final prices.
